A funeral plan is something that helps you plan for the future. While many people do not think about planning their own funerals, this is an easy way to remove that burden from your family. For example, if you do not make any arrangements or leave any instructions then it will be up to your surviving loved ones to make arrangements for and maybe even pay for your funeral at a time when they are least able to cope.
;
;Funeral Plan: A Definition
;
;A funeral plan is an easy way to arrange for all the details surrounding your funeral. All you have to do, in many cases, is choose the plan that sounds right to you. These plans will include everything that you will need for a funeral. For example, first and foremost, these plans include the services of a funeral director. This is the person who cares for and prepares the deceased for cremation or burial. This can include embalming, cleaning, and dressing the deceased.
;
;Additionally, the funeral plan will often cover transportation of the deceased and the deceased’s family, the use of a chapel or church for a wake and/or religious funeral service, and the cost of a cremation or burial. Funeral plans can also cover details like musicians, a coffin, bereavement counselling and more.
;
;The Idea behind Funeral Plans
;
;The idea behind funeral plans is peace of mind. Peace of mind for you because you know that your wishes will be met and that you will be taken care of when the time comes. You will also be able to rest assured that your family will not be unduly burdened during this time. Funerals can be very expensive, and if you have not made arrangements, your family might have to shell out for the cost of your funeral. This can be a financial hardship for many families when the average cost of a funeral is around £2000.
;
;Also, if you have not made arrangements, your family will have to decide what is appropriate for your funeral. For some people and some families, this is not a large concern, but if you think that your family will agonize over the details, it is best to take care of your arrangements beforehand through the use of a funeral plan.
;
